meanings.definition: The quality or state of being adamant.
meanings.sent1: Her adamances in sticking to her beliefs impressed everyone.
meanings.sent2: The adamances of the old tree roots made it impossible to move them.
meanings.sent3: Despite his adamances, he couldn't resist trying the new ice cream flavor.
meanings.sent4: The adamances of the mountain against the storm were awe-inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The adamances of the diamond made it stand out among the other gems.

meanings.definition: The act of being unyielding or inflexible.
meanings.sent1: His adamances in negotiations often led to successful deals.
meanings.sent2: The adamances of the metal rod made it difficult to bend.
meanings.sent3: The adamances of the cat refusing to move from the warm spot were amusing.
meanings.sent4: The adamances of the river against the rocks created a mesmerizing sight.
meanings.sent5: The adamances of the door lock kept everyone out of the room.
